title: Take A Bow: 3 Mumbai Landmarks Win UNESCO Asia-Pacific Award For Cultural Heritage Conservation
text:
This is a moment of pride for Mumbai and India, as three landmarks from the city - Flora Fountain, Gloria Church at Byculla and Keneseth Eliyahoo Synagogue at Kala Godha - have won the UNESCO Asia-Pacific Awards for Cultural Heritage Conservation this year!

Conservation architect Vikas Dilwari and his team who restored Flora Fountain, received the award under the category ‘Honourable Mention.’ The Jewish Synagogue restored by Abha Narain Lambah was given the ‘Award of Merit’ and Gloria Church restored by David Cardoz and and Ainsley Lewis received the same award.

Rediff

The UNESCO Asia-Pacific Awards for Cultural Heritage Conservation Programme ‘recognizes the efforts of private individuals and organizations that have successfully restored and conserved structures and buildings of heritage value in the region’.

The UNESCO reportedly said, "By recognizing private efforts to restore and adapt historic properties, the awards aim to encourage other property owners to undertake conservation projects within their communities, either independently or by seeking public-private partnerships."

Imagine the amount of hard work and ideas that these conservationists would have had to put in to restore these landmarks to their full glory, to have been considered worthy enough for a UNESCO Award.

This is actually a moment pride for all the individuals who worked towards the restoration of these landmarks. Kudos to them!
